activityUserComments.doc: Returns a list of recent activity on photos commented on by the calling user. Do not poll this method more than once an hour.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

per_page.doc: Number of items to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

activityUserPhotos.doc: Returns a list of recent activity on photos commented on by the calling user. Do not poll this method more than once an hour.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

timeframe.doc: The timeframe in which to return updates for. This can be specified in days ('2d') or hours ('4h'). The default behavoir is to return changes since the beginning of the previous user session.

per_page.doc: Number of items to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

authCheckToken.doc: Returns the credentials attached to an authentication token. This call must be signed as specified in the authentication API spec.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

authGetFrob.doc: Returns a frob to be used during authentication. This method call must be signed, and is deprecated in favour of OAuth.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

authGetFullToken.doc: Get the full authentication token for a mini-token. This method call must be signed.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

mini_token.doc: The mini-token typed in by a user. It should be 9 digits long. It may optionally contain dashes.

authGetToken.doc: Returns the auth token for the given frob, if one has been attached. This method call must be signed, and is deprecated in favour of OAuth.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

authOauthGetAccessToken.doc: Exchange an auth token from the old Authentication API, to an OAuth access token. Calling this method will delete the auth token used to make the request. The request must be signed.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

blogsGetList.doc: Get a list of configured blogs for the calling user.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

service.doc: Optionally only return blogs for a given service id. You can get a list of from flickr.blogs.getServices().

blogsGetServices.doc: Returns a list of Flickr supported blogging services.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

blogsPostPhoto.doc: Posts a photo to a blog.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

blog_id.doc: The ID of the blog to post to.

photo_id.doc: The ID of the photo to blog.

blog_password.doc: The password for the blog (used when the blog does not have a stored password).

service.doc: A Flickr supported blogging service. Instead of passing a blog id you can pass a service id and we'll post to the first blog of that service we find.

collectionsGetInfo.doc: Returns information for a single collection. Currently can only be called by the collection owner, this may change.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

collection_id.doc: The ID of the collection to fetch information for.

collectionsGetTree.doc: Returns a tree (or sub tree) of collections belonging to a given user.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

collection_id.doc: The ID of the collection to fetch a tree for, or zero to fetch the root collection. Defaults to zero.

user_id.doc: The ID of the account to fetch the collection tree for. Deafults to the calling user.

commonsGetInstitutions.doc: Retrieves a list of the current Commons institutions.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

contactsGetList.doc: Get a list of contacts for the calling user.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

filter.doc: An optional filter of the results. The following values are valid: friends (Only contacts who are friends, and not family), family (Only contacts who are family, and not friends), both (Only contacts who are both friends and family), neither (Only contacts who are neither friends nor family).

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1000. The maximum allowed value is 1000.

contactsGetListRecentlyUploaded.doc: Return a list of contacts for a user who have recently uploaded photos along with the total count of photos uploaded. This method is still considered experimental. We don't plan for it to change or to go away but so long as this notice is present you should write your code accordingly.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date_lastupload.doc: Limits the resultset to contacts that have uploaded photos since this date. The date should be in the form of a Unix timestamp. The default offset is (1) hour and the maximum (24) hours.

filter.doc: Limit the result set to all contacts or only those who are friends or family. Valid options are: ff (friends and family), all (all your contacts). Default value is "all".

contactsGetPublicList.doc: Get the contact list for a user.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the contact list for.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1000. The maximum allowed value is 1000.

favoritesAdd.doc: Adds a photo to a user's favorites list.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to add to the user's favorites.

favoritesGetList.doc: Returns a list of the user's favorite photos. Only photos which the calling user has permission to see are returned.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

min_fave_date.doc: Minimum date that a photo was favorited on. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

max_fave_date.doc: Maximum date that a photo was favorited on. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The user to fetch the favorites list for.

min_fave_date.doc: Minimum date that a photo was favorited on. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

max_fave_date.doc: Maximum date that a photo was favorited on. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

favoritesRemove.doc: Adds a photo to a user's favorites list.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to remove to the user's favorites.

galleriesAddPhoto.doc: Add a photo to a gallery.

gallery_id.doc: The ID of the gallery to add a photo to. Note: this is the compound ID returned in methods like flickr.galleries.getList, and flickr.galleries.getListForPhoto.

photo_id.doc: The photo ID to add to the gallery.

comment.doc: A short comment or story to accompany the photo.

galleriesCreate.doc: Create a new gallery for the calling user.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

description.doc: A short description for the gallery.

primary_photo_id.doc: The first photo to add to your gallery.

galleriesEditMeta.doc: Modify the metadata for a gallery.

title.doc: The new title for the gallery.

description.doc: The new description for the gallery.

galleriesEditPhoto.doc: Edit the comment for a gallery photo.

gallery_id.doc: The ID of the gallery to add a photo to. Note: this is the compound ID returned in methods like flickr.galleries.getList, and flickr.galleries.getListForPhoto.

photo_id.doc: The photo ID to add to the gallery.

galleriesEditPhotos.doc: Modify the photos in a gallery. Use this method to add, remove and re-order photos.

gallery_id.doc: The id of the gallery to modify. The gallery must belong to the calling user.

primary_photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to use as the 'primary' photo for the gallery. This id must also be passed along in photo_ids list argument.

photo_ids.doc: A comma-delimited list of photo ids to include in the gallery. They will appear in the set in the order sent. This list must contain the primary photo id. This list of photos replaces the existing list.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

gallery_id.doc: The gallery ID you are requesting information for.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to get a galleries list for. If none is specified, the calling user is assumed.

per_page.doc: Number of galleries to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

galleriesGetListForPhoto.doc: Return the list of galleries to which a photo has been added. Galleries are returned sorted by date which the photo was added to the gallery.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The ID of the photo to fetch a list of galleries for.

per_page.doc: Number of galleries to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

cat_id.doc: The category id to fetch a list of groups and sub-categories for. If not specified, it defaults to zero, the root of the category tree.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

group_id.doc: The NSID of the group to fetch information for.

lang.doc: The language of the group name and description to fetch. If the language is not found, the primary language of the group will be returned. Valid values are the same as in feeds.

groupsMembersGetList.doc: Get a list of the members of a group. The call must be signed on behalf of a Flickr member, and the ability to see the group membership will be determined by the Flickr member's group privileges.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

group_id.doc: Return a list of members for this group. The group must be viewable by the Flickr member on whose behalf the API call is made.

membertypes.doc: Comma separated list of member types. Accepted values: 2 (member), 3 (moderator), 4 (admin). By default returns all types. (Returning super rare member type "1: narwhal" isn't supported by this API method)

per_page.doc: Number of groups to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

groupsPoolsAdd.doc: Add a photo to a group's pool.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to add to the group pool. The photo must belong to the calling user.

group_id.doc: The NSID of the group whose pool the photo is to be added to.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to fetch the context for.

group_id.doc: The NSID of the group whose pool to fetch the photo's context for.

groupsPoolsGetGroups.doc: Returns a list of groups to which you can add photos.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

per_page.doc: Number of groups to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 400. The maximum allowed value is 400.

groupsPoolsGetPhotos.doc: Returns a list of pool photos for a given group, based on the permissions of the group and the user logged in (if any).

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

tags.doc: A tag to filter the pool with. At the moment only one tag at a time is supported.

user_id.doc: The nsid of a user. Specifiying this parameter will retrieve for you only those photos that the user has contributed to the group pool.

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 400.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

groupsPoolsRemove.doc: Remove a photo from a group pool.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to remove from the group pool. The photo must either be owned by the calling user of the calling user must be an administrator of the group.

group_id.doc: The NSID of the group who's pool the photo is to removed from.

groupsSearch.doc: Search for groups. 18+ groups will only be returned for authenticated calls where the authenticated user is over 18.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

per_page.doc: Number of groups to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

interestingnessGetList.doc: Returns the list of interesting photos for the most recent day or a user-specified date.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

predicate.doc: Limit the list of namespaces returned to those that have the following predicate.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

namespace.doc: Limit the list of pairs returned to those that have the following namespace.

predicate.doc: Limit the list of namespaces returned to those that have the following predicate.

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

per_page.doc: Number of predicates to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

namespace.doc: A namespace that all values should be restricted to.

predicate.doc: A predicate that all values should be restricted to.

per_page.doc: Number of values to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

machinetagsGetValues.doc: Return a list of unique values for a namespace and predicate.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

namespace.doc: A namespace that all values should be restricted to.

predicate.doc: A predicate that all values should be restricted to.

per_page.doc: Number of values to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

find_email.doc: The email address of the user to find (may be primary or secondary).

peopleFindByUsername.doc: Return a user's NSID, given their username.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch information about.

peopleGetPhotos.doc: Return photos from the given user's photostream. Only photos visible to the calling user will be returned. This method must be authenticated; to return public photos for a user, use flickr.people.getPublicPhotos.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user whose photos to return. A value of "me" will return the calling user's photos.

min_upload_date.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

max_upload_date.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

min_taken_date.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

max_taken_date.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

content_type.doc: Content type setting. Accepted values: 1 (photos only), 2 (screenshots only), 3 ('other' only), 4 (photos and screenshots), 5 (screenshots and 'other'), 6 (photos and 'other'), 7 (photos, screenshots, and 'other') (all)

privacy_filter.doc: Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view photos you own. Valid values are: 1 (public photos), 2 (private photos visible to friends), 3 (private photos visible to family), 4 (private photos visible to friends and family), 5 (completely private photos)

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

owner_id.doc: An NSID of a Flickr member. This will restrict the list of photos to those taken by that member.

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, date_person_added, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

lon.doc: The longitude of the photos to be updated whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photosLicensesSetInfo.doc: Sets the license for a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo you want to update the license for.

license_id.doc: The license to apply, or 0 (zero) to remove the current license. Note : as of this writing the "no known copyright restrictions" license (7) is not a valid argument.

photosNotesAdd.doc: Add a note to a photo. Coordinates and sizes are in pixels, based on the 500px image size shown on individual photo pages.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to add a note to

note_x.doc: The left coordinate of the note

note_y.doc: The top coordinate of the note

photosNotesDelete.doc: Delete a note from a photo.

note_id.doc: The id of the note to delete

photosNotesEdit.doc: Edit a note on a photo. Coordinates and sizes are in pixels, based on the 500px image size shown on individual photo pages.

note_id.doc: The id of the note to edit

note_x.doc: The left coordinate of the note

note_y.doc: The top coordinate of the note

photosPeopleAdd.doc: Add a person to a photo. Coordinates and sizes are in pixels, based on the 500px image size shown on individual photo pages.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to add a person to

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to add to the photo

person_x.doc: The left-most pixel co-ordinate of the box around the person.

person_y.doc: The top-most pixel co-ordinate of the box around the person.

person_w.doc: The width (in pixels) of the box around the person.

person_h.doc: The height (in pixels) of the box around the person.

photosPeopleDelete.doc: Remove a person from a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to remove a person from.

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to remove from the photo

photosPeopleDeleteCoords.doc: Remove the bounding box from a person in a photo

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to edit a person in.

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user whose bounding box you want to remove.

photosPeopleEditCoords.doc: Edit the bounding box of an existing person on a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to edit a person in.

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to edit in the photo

person_x.doc: The left-most pixel co-ordinate of the box around the person.

person_y.doc: The top-most pixel co-ordinate of the box around the person.

person_w.doc: The width (in pixels) of the box around the person.

person_h.doc: The height (in pixels) of the box around the person.

photosPeopleGetList.doc: Get a list of people in a given photo.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to get a list of people for.

photosRemoveTag.doc: Remove a tag from a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to add tags to.

tag_id.doc: The tag to remove from the photo. This parameter should contain a tag id, as returned by flickr.photos.getInfo.

photosSearch.doc: Return a list of photos matching some criteria. Only photos visible to the calling user will be returned. To return private or semi-private photos, the caller must be authenticated with 'read' permissions, and have permission to view the photos. Unauthenticated calls will only return public photos.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user who's photo to search. If this parameter isn't passed then everybody's public photos will be searched. A value of "me" will search against the calling user's photos for authenticated calls.

tags.doc: A comma-delimited list of tags. Photos with one or more of the tags listed will be returned. You can exclude results that match a term by prepending it with a - character.

tag_mode.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

text.doc: A free text search. Photos whose title, description or tags contain the text will be returned. You can exclude results that match a term by prepending it with a - character.

min_upload_date.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

max_upload_date.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

min_taken_date.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

max_taken_date.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

license.doc: The license id for photos (for possible values see the flickr.photos.licenses.getInfo method). Multiple licenses may be comma-separated.

sort.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc (unless you are doing a radial geo query, in which case the default sorting is by ascending distance from the point specified). The possible values are: date-posted-asc, date-posted-desc, date-taken-asc, date-taken-desc, interestingness-desc, interestingness-asc, and relevance.

privacy_filter.doc: Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view photos you own. Valid values are: 1 (public photos), 2 (private photos visible to friends), 3 (private photos visible to family), 4 (private photos visible to friends and family), 5 (completely private photos)

hbox.doc: A comma-delimited list of 4 values defining the Bounding Box of the area that will be searched. See API docs for more info.

accuracy.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. Current range is 1-16: World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region is ~6, City is ~11, Street is ~16. Defaults to maximum value if not specified.

content_type.doc: Content type setting. Accepted values: 1 (photos only), 2 (screenshots only), 3 ('other' only), 4 (photos and screenshots), 5 (screenshots and 'other'), 6 (photos and 'other'), 7 (photos, screenshots, and 'other') (all)

machine_tags.doc: Machine tag(s). See API docs for format. Multiple machine tags may be queried by passing a comma-separated list. The number of machine tags you can pass in a single query depends on the tag mode (AND or OR) that you are querying with. "AND" queries are limited to (16) machine tags. "OR" queries are limited to (8).

machine_tag_mode.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

group_id.doc: The id of a group who's pool to search. If specified, only matching photos posted to the group's pool will be returned.

contacts.doc: Search your contacts. Either 'all' or 'ff' for just friends and family. (Experimental)

woe_id.doc: A 32-bit identifier that uniquely represents spatial entities. (not used if bbox argument is present). See API docs for more info.

place_id.doc: A Flickr place id. (not used if bbox argument is present). See API docs for more info.

media.doc: Filter results by media type. Possible values are all (default), photos, videos

has_geo.doc: Any photo that has been geotagged, or if the value is "0" any photo that has not been geotagged. See API docs for more info.

geo_context.doc: Geo context is a numeric value representing the photo's geotagginess beyond latitude and longitude. See API docs for more info. Accepted values: 0 (not defined), 1 (indoors), 2 (outdoors)

lat.doc: A valid latitude, in decimal format, for doing radial geo queries. See API docs for more info.

lon.doc: A valid longitude, in decimal format, for doing radial geo queries. See API docs for more info.

radius.doc: A valid radius used for geo queries, greater than zero and less than 20 miles (or 32 kilometers), for use with point-based geo queries. The default value is 5 (km).

radius_units.doc: The unit of measure when doing radial geo queries. Valid options are "mi" (miles) and "km" (kilometers). The default is "km".

is_commons.doc: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are part of the Flickr Commons project. Default is false.

is_gallery.doc: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are in a gallery? Default is false, search all photos.

is_getty.doc: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are for sale on Getty. Default is false.

extras.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_m, url_z, url_l, url_o

per_page.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

photosSetContentType.doc: Set the content type of a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to set the adultness of.

content_type.doc: The content type of the photo. Must be one of: 1 for Photo, 2 for Screenshot, and 3 for Other.

photosSetDates.doc: Set one or both of the dates for a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to edit dates for.

date_posted.doc: The date the photo was uploaded to flickr (see the dates documentation)

date_taken.doc: The date the photo was taken (see the dates documentation)

date_taken_granularity.doc: The granularity of the date the photo was taken (see the dates documentation)

photosSetMeta.doc: Set the meta information for a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to set information for.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to set permissions for.

is_public.doc: 1 to set the photo to public, 0 to set it to private.

is_friend.doc: 1 to make the photo visible to friends when private, 0 to not.

is_family.doc: 1 to make the photo visible to family when private, 0 to not.

perm_comment.doc: Who can add comments to the photo and its notes. one of: 0: nobody, 1: friends & family, 2: contacts, 3: everybody.

perm_addmeta.doc: Who can add notes and tags to the photo. one of: 0: nobody / just the owner, 1: friends & family, 2: contacts, 3: everybody.

photosSetSafetyLevel.doc: Set the safety level of a photo.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to set the adultness of.

safety_level.doc: The safety level of the photo. Must be one of: 1 for Safe, 2 for Moderate, and 3 for Restricted.

hidden.doc: Whether or not to additionally hide the photo from public searches. Must be either 1 for Yes or 0 for No.

photosSetTags.doc: Set the tags for a photo.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to set the tags for.

tags.doc: All tags for the photo (as a single space-delimited string).

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to rotate.

degrees.doc: The amount of degrees by which to rotate the photo (clockwise) from it's current orientation. Valid values are 90, 180 and 270.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

lon.doc: The longitude whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 4 decimal places will be truncated.

accuracy.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. The default is 16.

replace.doc: Replaces a photo that has already been uploaded to Flickr. Uploading apps can call the flickr.people.getUploadStatus method in the regular API to obtain file and bandwidth limits for the user.

photo_id.doc: The ID of the photo to replace.

async.doc: Photos may be replaced in async mode, for applications that don't want to wait around for an upload to complete, leaving a socket connection open the whole time. Processing photos asynchronously is recommended. Please consult the documentation for details. Set to 1 for async mode, 0 for sync mode.

statsGetCollectionDomains.doc: Get a list of referring domains for a collection

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

collection_id.doc: The id of the collection to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all collections will be returned.

per_page.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

domain.doc: The domain to return referrers for. This should be a hostname (eg: "flickr.com") with no protocol or pathname.

collection_id.doc: The id of the collection to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all collections will be returned.

per_page.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

statsGetCollectionStats.doc: Get the number of views on a collection for a given date.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

collection_id.doc: The id of the collection to get stats for.

statsGetPhotoDomains.doc: Get a list of referring domains for a photo.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all photos will be returned.

per_page.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

statsGetPhotoReferrers.doc: Get a list of referring domains for a photo.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

domain.doc: The domain to return referrers for. This should be a hostname (eg: "flickr.com") with no protocol or pathname.

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all photos will be returned.

per_page.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

statsGetPhotostreamReferrers.doc: Get a list of referrers from a given domain to a user's photostream

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

domain.doc: The domain to return referrers for. This should be a hostname (eg: "flickr.com") with no protocol or pathname.

per_page.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

statsGetPhotostreamStats.doc: Get the number of views on a user's photostream for a given date.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

statsGetPopularPhotos.doc: List the photos with the most views, comments or favorites.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day. If no date is provided, all time view counts will be returned.

sort.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Defaults to views. The possible values are views, comments and favorites. Other sort options are available through flickr.photos.search.

per_page.doc: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

page.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

statsGetTotalViews.doc: Get the overall view counts for an account.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

date.doc: Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format. A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day. If no date is provided, all time view counts will be returned.

tagsGetClusterPhotos.doc: Returns the first 24 photos for a given tag cluster.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

tag.doc: The tag that this cluster belongs to.

cluster_id.doc: The top three tags for the cluster, separated by dashes (just like the url).

tagsGetClusters.doc: Returns a list of tag clusters for the given tag.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

tag.doc: The tag to fetch clusters for.

tagsGetHotList.doc: Returns a list of hot tags for the given period.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

period.doc: The period for which to fetch hot tags. Valid values are day and week (defaults to day).

count.doc: The number of tags to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed value is 200.

tagsGetListPhoto.doc: Get the tag list for a given photo.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

photo_id.doc: The id of the photo to return tags for.

tagsGetListUser.doc: Get the tag list for a given user (or the currently logged in user).

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the tag list for. If this argument is not specified, the currently logged in user (if any) is assumed.

tagsGetListUserPopular.doc: Get the popular tags for a given user (or the currently logged in user).

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the tag list for. If this argument is not specified, the currently logged in user (if any) is assumed.

count.doc: Number of popular tags to return. defaults to 10 when this argument is not present.

tagsGetListUserRaw.doc: Get the raw versions of a given tag (or all tags) for the currently logged-in user.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

tag.doc: The tag you want to retrieve all raw versions for.

tagsGetRelated.doc: Returns a list of tags 'related' to the given tag, based on clustered usage analysis.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

tag.doc: The tag to fetch related tags for.

testEcho.doc: A testing method which echoes all parameters back in the response.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

testLogin.doc: A testing method which checks if the caller is logged in then returns their username.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

upload.doc: Uploads a photo. Uploading apps can call the flickr.people.getUploadStatus method in the regular API to obtain file and bandwidth limits for the user.

title.doc: The title of the photo. Optional.

description.doc: A description of the photo. May contain some limited HTML. Optional.

tags.doc: A space-seperated list of tags to apply to the photo. Optional.

is_public.doc: Set to 0 for no, 1 for yes. Specifies who can view the photo. Optional.

is_friend.doc: Set to 0 for no, 1 for yes. Specifies who can view the photo. Optional.

is_family.doc: Set to 0 for no, 1 for yes. Specifies who can view the photo. Optional.

safety_level.doc: Set to 1 for Safe, 2 for Moderate, or 3 for Restricted. Optional.

content_type.doc: Set to 1 for Photo, 2 for Screenshot, or 3 for Other. Optional.

hidden.doc: Set to 1 to keep the photo in global search results, 2 to hide from public searches. Optional.

async.doc: Flickr can process photos in async mode, for applications that need to post multiple photos and don't want to wait around for each one to complete, leaving a socket connection open the whole time. Set to 1 for async mode, 0 for sync mode.

urlsGetGroup.doc: Returns the url to a group's page.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

group_id.doc: The NSID of the group to fetch the url for.

urlsGetUserPhotos.doc: Returns the url to a user's photos.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the url for. If omitted, the calling user is assumed.

urlsGetUserProfile.doc: Returns the url to a user's profile.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

user_id.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the url for. If omitted, the calling user is assumed.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

urlsLookupGroup.doc: Returns a group NSID, given the url to a group's page or photo pool.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

url.doc: The url to the group's page or photo pool.

urlsLookupUser.doc: Returns a user NSID, given the url to a user's photos or profile.

format.doc: Response format. Accepted values: rest (REST), xmlrpc (XML-RPC), soap (SOAP), soap2 (Alternate SOAP) json (JSON), serial_php (Serialized PHP).

url.doc: The url to the user's profile or photos page.
